reviews.review_msg: Easy but disappointing GDBA class. Discussion posts and accompanying peer reviews were extremely tedious. You're rewarded for regurgitation. Literally, write a blurb and namedrop definitions, and you'll score 9+. MBTNs were more tedious. 30% of our grade was based on a reflection... again, name drop definitions like "SWOT analysis" you'll do well.

Online GDBA course (BUS556, Marketing Management) and didn't have a choice for instructor selection. The lectures were useless and added no value. E-Mail interactions with Srabana were abrasive and lacked empathy. The marketing simulation was fun but that was about it. This course was a waste of time and money but it was needed to graduate.

I'm glad I waited to take BUS 345 with Srabana because she was a great professor! She spread out the group project with deliverables every few weeks and gave us feedback to make sure we were on the right path. She was very caring and understanding about the difficulties of online courses and made a lot of accommodations for students.
Her lecture is fun.

Srabana's lectures are pretty useless if you don't read the textbook. You are going to need to read the textbook and take good notes from the textbook because her midterm and finals are heavily based on that. There's a midterm, group project, small individual assignment and a final. Exams are straight to the point, small standard deviation tho!

Took it in the evening with her and we only went an hour and a half every week (supposed to be 4). Group projects and midterm was relatively easy... I was surprised since it's a 4 credit course. Defs take it with her (in the evening is shorter haha)

Lots of little things like assignments, exercises, and such throughout the lectures and semester to stay on top of. Easy marker - her feedback literally tells you what to fix. Lectures are straight from the textbook. Expect to do a LOT of group work, and statistics work as well.
Srabana's expectations are a little bit unclear at times, but she's very helpful if you talk to her individually during office hours. Not a bad prof overall.

Her lectures are very dry and dragging. She covers about 2hrs of material in 3-4hrs. The course consists of mostly group projects and the final is worth a lot. Her final focuses mostly in the last few weeks of the semester so be sure to pay attention to those. Final is hard and long and her lectures don't help. Selflear the statistical stuff a lot!

Attending lectures is helpful so you know what her emphasis will be for the midterm and final. The final was VERY hard. However if you put in some effort you will do good in the course overall. Yupin is also really nice!

You won't learn anything during lecture. She is a really unclear lecturer. The lectures are super long, longer than necessary. She can finish the class in 2.5 hrs max, but goes so slowly that it takes 4hrs. The lectures are death, their so boring, and you won't learn anything because she's super unclear. Get ready to self-teach using the textbook.

Yupin Yang is a helpful prof with good knowledge of her subject. I feel her accent was not difficult to understand, and students that work hard earn better grades. Lectures are engaging for the most part.

She is very nice. But, she should be teaching kindergarten. I am offended that SFU Business would hire her as a professor. If anyone tells you otherwise, they are being nice because they feel guilty for talking bad about her since she is genuinely a nice person-- who can't teach, or speak English. Easy class, but you'll take absolutely nothing away
Has some difficulty in communication lecture materials, but nothing distracting! Great enthusiasm when teaching and makes seminars somewhat interesting!

Fun prof, very chill and humorous in class. Didn't grade things very quickly, which was sometimes an issue. If you keep up with the readings for quizzes and the final exam you should do fine. Make sure to mention croissants in any class you have with him, he gives bonus marks if you include them in class discussion or mention them in assignments.

Cluny was a delight to have as a professor, she's organized, thoughtful, and made coming to class engaging. She's the professor that's put the most effort into teaching that I've had so far. There was a decent amount of deliverables, but it's manageable and ~40% is group work (she lets you choose groups!). Easy bonus marks too! Highly recommended.

Cluny tries to engage the class during lectures, but the activities we do are so pointless and irrelevant to the course content. Her Canvas setup is extremely hard to navigate. A ridiculous amount of work required (e.g. minimum of two chapters per week). Her exam submitted earlier than the deadline on Canvas and she didn't seem to care.

He is The Best Teacher I have ever had in University. I was really lucky to have taken a class with him. Besides his personal achievements and knowledge about what he is teaching, he is the friendliest prof you will have. He is amazing

Emily is extremely kind and very approachable. She genuinely wants you to do well. The class was straightforward and depended on group projects. Her lectures aren't the most helpful for her exams though.

While she is nice, she is clearly and inexperienced prof. Her teaching style isn't very effective. Takes marks for participation but doesn't really teach anything in class (no examples she says are used in the exams). Very broad description of group projects given.

Probably the best professor I've had in Beedie. She is very sweet and clearly cares about her students and their learning experience. Overall very chill and approachable. Genuinely wants you to understand the content she teaches and is clearly passionate. Her exams and assignments are fair, and she's very understanding of students.

Emily is very nice and approachable, but I feel like she's not very experienced with teaching yet. Her lectures are kind of dry and I didn't learn much. Midterm is easy if you study from the textbook.

I enjoyed taking the course with Emily so much! Whenever I have problems about the course content or the group project, Emily is always there to help me. The course was simple: 1 mid-term, 1 final, 2 discussion questions, and a group project. The group project was highly related to the course content, was helpful to better understand the content!

Honestly, If you want to actually learning Marketing Research method, I would like recommend you take David's course. He is a nice person and his lecture is well organize. You will learn how to use SPSS and basic marketing research methods. Be ready to prepare the lecture notes before you come, because you have to take pop quiz. Exams are easy.

The class is not necessarily difficult, but it requires A LOT of work. For the 2nd half of the semester, be prepared to learn class material/SPSS by yourself and spend hours on assignments that are literally worth 5%.  Also be prepared for life stories and overall weird/uncomfortable vibes.

The first half was alright, but the second half was absolutely brutal. Weekly assignments required more effort than they are worth. Prof focused too much on basic topics and not enough on complicated topics.... Unless you want to reteach yourself EVERYTHING from BUEC 232 and BUS 336 without any help at all, DON'T DO THIS CLASS WITH DAVID!

DON'T DO IT. Unless you understand how to use SPSS or are already practiced in Marketing Research, this professor sucks. He goes on and on about irrelevant stories, and doesn't teach ANYTHING, especially when it comes to the more difficult statistical topics. FIND. SOMEONE. ELSE.

Save yourself the time and take it with another prof. David's assignments are worth a minimal amount but are a) marked hard b) no criteria is given c) take way too much time for what they're worth of your grade. He also does not teach course material in class but rather talks about irrelevant life stories. For the sake of your sanity, don't do it

dobson is OKAY. when you email him i guess depending on his mood he will either send you a full letter or one word response. I'm not sure about 336, but he's EZ for 345 but a lot of work etc. he is very enthused about stats to say the least but i haven't seen him yelling at anyone thus far.

Daniel was a wonderful prof, super passionate about what he taught. Group project is a decent chunk of your grade, so make sure to spend time on that. Overall, course is pretty interesting and not TOO tough. Daniel though, he is great. Would take a class with him in a heart-beat.

Daniel is awesome. He's quite passionate about the courses he teaches and super approachable as a instructor. Cares about his students! His background is in statistics so I really recommend him for courses like BUS 464, 345, 445. His tests are usually based on his slides, so make sure you know them well and refer to the textbook as you need.
